channel.title: What is Max's NPC ID in RuneScape?
channel.description: Max is the fairly new NPC who sells the Max skill cape in RuneScape. Anyone know his NPC ID?

item.title: What is Max's NPC ID in RuneScape?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy

item.title: What is Max's NPC ID in RuneScape?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:3, topic:397325”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=494476.msg3615063#msg3615063 date=1306893269]

Max is the fairly new NPC who sells the Max skill cape in RuneScape. Anyone know his NPC ID?

You could find it yourself by using on of the many available bots, and selecting a “Show Npc ID” option.

Or if you want to do it the hard way, decompile the client, make the changes necessary to compile, find the NpcDefinition class, then loop through all Npcs found in the cache until you find one whose name is correct.

I believe that the openRS cache lib might be of some assistance.
[/quote]
You actually only need to repair the 1 class, as long as you can run the command properly. How do you think I cracked the minecraft launcher?

@Topic - As said, your best bet is to rip the client, and run through the NPC’s (if you can find the class) at startup and dump the ID and names.[/quote]

My guess would have been BCEL or another bytecode library.

Hmm, maybe I should start work on my bytecode library again…

Read full topic
item.source: What is Max's NPC ID in RuneScape?

item.title: What is Max's NPC ID in RuneScape?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:2, topic:397325”][quote author=Kyle8497 link=topic=494476.msg3615017#msg3615017 date=1306892148]
Max is the fairly new NPC who sells the Max skill cape in RuneScape. Anyone know his NPC ID?
[/quote]

You could find it yourself by using on of the many available bots, and selecting a “Show Npc ID” option.

Or if you want to do it the hard way, decompile the client, make the changes necessary to compile, find the NpcDefinition class, then loop through all Npcs found in the cache until you find one whose name is correct.

I believe that the openRS cache lib might be of some assistance.[/quote]
You actually only need to repair the 1 class, as long as you can run the command properly. How do you think I cracked the minecraft launcher?

@Topic - As said, your best bet is to rip the client, and run through the NPC’s (if you can find the class) at startup and dump the ID and names.

Read full topic
item.source: What is Max's NPC ID in RuneScape?

item.title: What is Max's NPC ID in RuneScape?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Kyle8497:

Max is the fairly new NPC who sells the Max skill cape in RuneScape. Anyone know his NPC ID?

You could find it yourself by using on of the many available bots, and selecting a “Show Npc ID” option.

Or if you want to do it the hard way, decompile the client, make the changes necessary to compile, find the NpcDefinition class, then loop through all Npcs found in the cache until you find one whose name is correct.

I believe that the openRS cache lib might be of some assistance.
